page.title: 08The Fishing Fleet at Rye
page.content: Rye is situated by the river Rother and was once an island. It is 2\ miles from the coast and the river is tidal. In Rye the boats are mostly trawlers and small gill net boats. They vary in size from 5 to 18 metres and there are roughly 30 of them. They catch many different species of fish. The bulk of them are plaice and whiting. These fish and others are sold in the fish market where the boats are moored up. The fishermen drop their nets between 1/4 mile and 12 miles offshore and the depth that thay drop their nets again varies from 5 t 60 metres. A Rye fisherman goes out to fish day or night depending on the weather. Most fishermen live in Rye or in surrounding villages. The registration is RY for Rye.
